image.altText: A selfie of a woman with dark hair, wearing an orange jumper

items.synopsis: Tanya Hinrichsen was found guilty last year of conspiring to murder her husband Steven and was handed a 22-year non-parole period, but her conviction has been set aside pending a retrial.

title.children: SA woman granted retrial over alleged involvement in husband's murder

image.altText: Al-Hajjeh Umm Al-Saeed Abu Amer in black clothing looks toward the camera

items.synopsis: Displaced civilians in Gaza say after mosques and schools were hit by Israeli air strikes, they have nowhere to find safety, while Israel recruits advocates for the country online.

title.children: Palestinians say nowhere in Gaza is safe from air strikes, as Israel recruits online influencers

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi stressed in a phone call with British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak the need to ensure regularity of humanitarian relief services and aid to Palestinians in Gaza, the Egyptian presidency said in statement. Türkiye has said it is prepared to send humanitarian aid to Palestinians hit by the conflict centred on Gaza but it is very hard to deliver under the current circumstances, a Turkish defence ministry official said on Thursday. "The situation in the region is very complicated. Under current circumstances, it is very difficult to deliver aid there. But Turkish Armed Forces is ready to carry out tasks assigned to deliver aid there," the defence ministry official told reporters. Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Egypt stressed the need for humanitarian relief as Türkiye offers to send aid

children.content: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi stressed in a phone call with British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak the need to ensure regularity of humanitarian relief services and aid to Palestinians in Gaza, the Egyptian presidency said in statement.

Türkiye has said it is prepared to send humanitarian aid to Palestinians hit by the conflict centred on Gaza but it is very hard to deliver under the current circumstances, a Turkish defence ministry official said on Thursday.

"The situation in the region is very complicated. Under current circumstances, it is very difficult to deliver aid there. But Turkish Armed Forces is ready to carry out tasks assigned to deliver aid there," the defence ministry official told reporters.

props.alt: Supplies on pallets in front of a military aircraft.

children.content: Jordanian military personnel loads humanitarian aid and supplies onto a military aircraft destined for Gaza.
(Reuters: Jehad Shelbak)
Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Israel's military spokesperson says that Israel was able to confirm the identities of 97 people taken hostage into Gaza during an attack by Hamas on Saturday. The offensive Israel launched on the blockaded Palestinian enclave since was meant to eliminate the ability of the Islamist militant movement to govern, Daniel Hagari said in a televised press briefing. "The military is preparing for the next stage of the war," he said, adding that 222 soldiers had been killed since Saturday. Public broadcaster Kan said the Israeli death toll had risen to more than 1,300 people killed since Saturday. Gaza authorities say more than 1,200 people have been killed and more 5,000 people have been wounded.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israeli military spokesperson: Hamas holding at least 97 people hostage

children.content: Israel's military spokesperson
says that Israel was able to
confirm the identities of 97 people taken hostage into Gaza
during an attack by Hamas on Saturday.

The offensive Israel launched on the blockaded Palestinian enclave since was meant to eliminate the ability of the Islamist militant movement to govern, Daniel Hagari said in a televised press briefing.
"The military is preparing for the next stage of the war," he said,
adding that 222 soldiers had been killed since Saturday.
Public broadcaster Kan said the
Israeli death toll had risen to more than 1,300 people
killed since Saturday.
Gaza authorities say more than 1,200 people have been killed
and more
5,000 people have been wounded.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Israel's Minister of Energy and Infrastructure, Israel Katz, has taken to X to announce that no electricity or water will be supplied to Gaza until those that have been kidnapped during Hamas' attacks over the weekend. "Humanitarian aid to Gaza? No electrical switch will be turned on, no water hydrant will be opened and no fuel truck will enter until the Israeli abductees are returned home. Humanitarian for humanitarian. And no one will preach us morals," he wrote. At least a 150 people have been kidnapped during the attacks. Hamas have threatened to execute a captive for each home in Gaza hit without warning but there has been no indication Hamas has carried out its threat.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israel's energy minister says 'no electrical switch will be turned on' until abductees are returned home

children.content: Israel's Minister of Energy and Infrastructure, Israel Katz, has taken to X to announce that no electricity or water will be supplied to Gaza until those that have been kidnapped during Hamas' attacks over the weekend.
"Humanitarian aid to Gaza?

No electrical switch will be turned on, no water hydrant will be opened and no fuel truck will enter until the Israeli abductees are returned home. Humanitarian for humanitarian. And no one will preach us morals," he wrote.

At least a 150 people have been kidnapped during the attacks. Hamas have threatened to execute a captive for each home in Gaza hit without warning but there has been no indication Hamas has carried out its threat.

image.altText: Black letters that spell out PwC on a white wall with red, orange and yellow graphic squares above the letter C.
